children: Shootings of whites by police closely mirrored the geography of the nation as a whole. Western states like
, and

demonstrated the highest rates while the northeastern United States had consistently low rates. Of all races, whites were the second least likely to be shot by the police. Perhaps most startingly, no whites were killed in the
during this time period, meaning the city's high rate of police shootings were exclusively of people of color.
